title: Practice E1 — Exam 1 Prep (Chapters 1–4)
description: Practice set aligned to Exam 1 style. Covers SIGs, conversions, dosage problems, and percentage error from Chapters 1–4.

easy.question: Each tablet of TYLENOL WITH CODEINE contains 30 mg codeine and 300 mg acetaminophen. If a patient takes 2 tablets daily for 7 days, how many mg of each drug are taken?
A cough syrup contains 10 mg per 5 mL. How many mg are in 120 mL?
hints: Find mg/mL then multiply by total volume.

easy.question: An ophthalmic solution has 1 mg/mL. If the eyedropper delivers 20 drops/mL, how many mg are in 2 drops?
Add 0.0025 kg, 1750 mg, 2.25 g, and 825,000 μg. Express in grams.
Interpret SIG: ii gtt. each eye q4h p.r.n. pain.
easy.answer: Instill 2 drops in each eye every 4 hours as needed for pain
easy.solution: Instill 2 drops in each eye every 4 hours as needed for pain.

easy.question: Balance SR=4 mg. A pharmacist weighs 50 mg of a substance. What is the maximum % error?

hard.question: A pint (473 mL) of acyclovir suspension contains 200 mg/5 mL. How many mg per pint?
Oral solution: 80 mg lopinavir + 20 mg ritonavir per mL. How many mg of each in 0.4 mL?
Interpret: Mesalamine 1.2 g p.o. q.d. c food.
hard.answer: Take 1.2 g by mouth once daily with food
hard.solution: Take 1.2 g by mouth once daily with food.

hard.question: 10-mL graduate weighs 42.745 g. With 5 mL water, total weight is 47.675 g. True 5 mL water should weigh 5 g. Calculate % error.
Prescription balance SR=6 mg. To weigh 50 mg chlorpheniramine maleate with error ≤5%, explain aliquot method.
hard.answer: Weigh ≥120 mg mixture containing 50 mg drug and take proportion.
hard.solution: Prepare mixture ≥120 mg with drug+diluent. Then aliquot mixture to obtain 50 mg drug equivalent.

hard.question: Patient prescription: Day 1 q.i.d. (4 tabs); Day 2 t.i.d. (3 tabs); Days 3–7 b.i.d. (10 tabs); Days 8–30 q.d. (23 tabs). Total?
